attributes.action: Change the e-petitions site to allow for more details
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The current length of petition details (1,000 characters) is nowhere near enough to discuss the nuances of difficult issues.

It would seem that this limit has been imposed to deliberately keep detail out of petitions, as technology to give a higher limit is easily available and affordable. To prove how weak and engineered this limit is, I was able to post 65,535 characters to the 'special requests to the web team' field in a test and the system accepted this without complaint.

7,000 petitions X 1,000 characters = 6.6MB (approx).

I feel that a limit of 20,000 to 25,000 characters per petition should suffice.

7,000 petitions X 25,000 characters = 167MB (approx).

If the government is willing to increase the limit, I will offer to personally buy and donate to them a 300GB drive to host it all. That should be enough to hold the details of 12 million petitions (approx), assuming they were all maximum length.

rejection.details: Comments about the petitions system should be sent to team@petitions.pm.gov.uk.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
